wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Parr (1769–1847) was an English slave trader who profited from the Atlantic slave trade. He invested in at least 30 slave voyages. One of the slave ships that he had built for the slave trade, Parr, exploded on her maiden voyage. A street in Liverpool where he built a warehouse is named after him.

response: The house was built for the slave trader Thomas Parr. Parr sold his house to the institution and was one of its founder members.https://lbhrg.com/thomasparr/ Many of the people who set up the institution were former slave traders.https://historicengland.org.uk/research/inclusive-heritage/the-slave-trade-and-abolition/sites-of-memory/slave-traders-and-plantation-wealth/liverpool-and-the-north-west/
*Thomas Parr (MP for Westmorland) (1407–1461); English landowner, MP and under-sheriff of Westmorland
*Thomas Parr (died 1517) (–1517), English courtier and father of Queen Katherine Parr
*Thomas Parr (of Bencoolen) (died 1807), British resident in Bencoolen, commemorated in the Thomas Parr Monument
